Reviews.Title: Just Okay
Reviews.Author: Rebecca "Rebecca"
Reviews.Content: Well, I received this camera about a year and a half ago at christmas.It take okay pictures, but has NO picturetaking ability in low light.For example, if it is around 7 or 8 in the evening, you will get NOTHING.just black, maybe some shadows.Also, recently the shutter on the lens has stopped working, and it no longer takes good pictues.It takes a long time to actually take the pictures too.But for what it cost, it has definatly delivered.I would recommend this camera to someone who likes taking pictures for the sake of pictures, but not someone who cares about quality.It is decent, and affordable.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Cherry
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before a trip abroad and was happy because I got such a good price.  In the end, however, the camera was a waste of money.  The pictures were not very good, but I guess I should have expected that from 5.1 mega pixels.  The most annoying thing was the camera kept turning off if it was idle for more than ten seconds.  I would go to take a picture but had to wait for the camera to turn on all over again.  Not a big deal except when the object you're photographing is gone.  I ended up giving this camera away and bought an 8.3 mega pixel camera that is A LOT better.In the end I gave the camera two stars because it is lightweight and not a bad price for the mega pixels.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at a bargain price of $25 but still think I got ripped off. The camera works just fine- its not turning off, all the parts work etc. The picture quality however is just horrible. And I disagree with Cherry; I don't think the megapixel count has anything to do with it. I have a 5.0 MP Canon Powershot SD400 and it works beautifully. My LG Dare phone is a 3.2 MP camera and it still works better than this Polaroid a515! The low light environments are impossible as Rebecca mentions. Also the focus is completely off. I take a picture of the desk in front of me and instead it focuses on the wall 20 feet away. I tried multiple different angles and lighting but all yielded the same results. Another detriment is the zoom capabilities. There is no optical zoom on this camera which means if you want to zoom with the 'digital zoom' you will severely sacrifice resolution. The video function is unbelievably choppy and essentially useless.

Reviews.Title: The On and Off Camera
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I hate this camera. It doesn't work now after being used for a while. I just wish it was made with care and put together correctly. I turned it on recently, took a picture, and it froze. I turned it off and then back on, and nothing happened. It froze and I have a feeling that's how it's gonna stay.
